fields.name: Standard Item Rental
fields.terms:
This agreement made on [Date] between [Owner Name] ('Owner') and [Tenant Name] ('Tenant').
1. Rented Item: [Item Name/Description]
2. Rental Period: From [Start Date] to [End Date].
3. Rental Fee: $[Amount] payable via [Method].
4. Condition: Tenant acknowledges receipt in good condition and agrees to return it in the same condition, normal wear and tear excepted.
5. Late Fees: A fee of $[Late Fee Amount] per day applies for late returns.
6. Liability: Tenant assumes responsibility for loss or damage.
7. Governing Law: This agreement is governed by local laws.

fields.name: Event Venue Booking
fields.terms:
Venue Booking Confirmation
Venue: [Venue Name]
Client: [Client Name]
Date(s): [Event Date(s)]
Time: [Start Time] - [End Time]
Rental Fee: $[Amount]
Payment Schedule: 50% deposit due [Deposit Due Date], balance due [Balance Due Date].
Cancellation Policy: [Details, e.g., No refund within 30 days].
Included Services: [List services, e.g., Tables, Chairs, Basic Sound System].
Rules & Regulations: [Link or details on venue rules].

fields.question: How do I list an item for rent?
fields.answer: Go to your Dashboard, click 'Post Rental', fill in all the details including title, description, price, category, location (city/country), and upload relevant photos or videos. Submit the form. Your listing may require admin approval depending on platform settings.

fields.question: How does payment work?
fields.answer: Currently, Chagua facilitates the agreement, but payments are handled offline directly between the item owner and the renter based on the instructions provided by the owner (viewable after creating a contract or making a payment record). Always confirm payment methods and details securely. Payment records can be marked as 'Approved' by an admin once confirmation is received.

fields.question: What is the verification process?
fields.answer: To increase trust, users can upload verification documents through their profile page. Chagua admins review these manually. Businesses might undergo additional checks like site visits. Verified users and rentals display a verification badge.

fields.question: How are disputes handled?
fields.answer: If there's an issue with a rental or contract, first try communicating directly with the other party via Chagua messaging. If unresolved, you can raise a formal dispute through the relevant contract page. An admin may review the case based on the contract terms and evidence provided.
